Info Queries

To make information queries free for the Boba community, Bob AI maintains a huge reservoir of pre-fabricated queries to get you introduced to the Boba Network and its ecosystem. These queries must be prefixed with an 'i:', for example, 'i:what is boba?'. These are directly processed by Bob AI's backend without making additional third party calls and are 100% free. Here are some of the info queries you can use:

• what is boba?
• what does the boba network do?
• how can i get started on boba?
• what are some cool projects on boba?
• what are some good ___ projects on boba? (replace ___ with defi, nft, infrastructure, etc)
• what are the network details for boba?
• what is bob ai?
• tell me about the boba grants program.
• what is the latest news about boba.
Please note that the queries are case insensitive and must be preceded by 'i:'. The above is a list of common queries but this is not the exhaustive list, which contains over 10000 queries. Please refer to the query file here.

Transaction Queries

To enable the users to be able to complete transactions on the Boba Network without much hassle, Bob AI offers many transaction queries that can be used in the chat interface. Here are some of the transaction queries you can use:

• save ___ as ___ (where ___ represents the target EVM address and ___ represents the contact name)

• fetch ___ (where ___ represents the target contact name)

• update ___ to ___ (where ___ represents the target contact name and ___ represents the new wallet address it should correspond to)

• send ___ token to ____ (where ___ represents token amount and code followed by the receiver address)

• send ___ NFT to ____ (coming soon)

• swap ___ tokens for ___ (coming soon)

• stake ____ tokens (coming soon)

Please note that the queries are case insensitive and must be preceded by 'tx:'. Also, they will prompt you to sign-up the transaction with your wallet. The query will fail if you are not logged in with your Metamask.

Custom Queries

To enable the users to ask something beyond these, Bob AI has custom queries. These must be preceded by a "keyval:", where the keyval is a secret key (usually 12 character long) which can be obtained after successfully applying for the Beta Program.
